contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Station | name=Quattro Venti | type=Italial national railways ([[Ferrovie dello Stato]]), [[Ferrovie regionali del Lazio|FRL]] | image= | image_size= | image_caption= | address=Viale dei Quattro Venti, [[Rome]] | coordinates= | line=FR3 | other= | structure=Underground | platform= | depth=ca. 65 m | levels= | tracks=2 | parking=Interchange | bicycle= | baggage_check= | passengers= | pass_year= | pass_percent= | pass_system= | opened=15-10-2006 | closed= | rebuilt= | electrified= | ADA=Yes | code= | owned=Rete Ferroviaria Italiana S.p.A. | zone=Urban | former= | services=[[Image:Ferrovia regionale laziale FR3.svg|40px]] | mpassengers= }} '''Quattro Venti''' is a minor [[railway station]] of [[Rome]], located in the district of [[Monteverde (Rome)|Monteverde]], between the stations of [[Roma Trastevere railway station|Roma Trastevere]] and [[Roma San Pietro railway station|Roma San Pietro]]. ==Overview== It is served by trains of the [[FR3 (Ferrovie regionali del Lazio)|Ferrovie regionali del Lazio 3]], forming an intermediate stop between [[Trastevere railway station]] and [[San Pietro railway station]]. The station is located between Viale dei Quattro Venti and Via Antonio Cesari, inside the [[Janiculum]] hill. The station was inaugurated officially on 16 November 2006, after 7 years of construction. It is the second deepest railway station of Europe, after one of the railway stations of Prague.{{Citation needed|date=February 2008}} ==Services== On weekdays, the following frequencies are offered: *4 trains per hour for [[Roma Ostiense railway station]] and [[Cesano (RM)|Cesano]] *2 trains per hour to [[Bracciano]] *1 train per hour to [[Viterbo]] Sundays and holidays see a diminished service. {{S-start|noclear=yes}} {{S-rail|title=FRR}} {{S-line|system=FRR|line=FR3|previous=Roma Trastevere|next=Roma San Pietro}} {{End}} {{coord missing|Italy}} [[Category:Railway stations in Rome|Quattro Venti]] [[Category:Railway stations opened in 2006]] {{Italy-railstation-stub}}
